conclusion: Analyze forces acting on copper rod when energized and not energized using magnetic force and tension concepts.
When not energized, the weight of the rod is balanced by tension in the wires: T_0 = mg.
Weight of the rod is W = mg, where m is mass and g is gravity.
When energized, rod experiences magnetic force: F_magnetic = I L B.
Magnetic force direction determined by right-hand rule; current must flow from N to M for upward force.
Tension when energized is 1/4 of tension when not energized: T = 1/4 T_0 = 1/4 mg.
Total force when energized balances weight: T + F_magnetic = mg.
Solve for magnetic force: I L B = mg - 1/4 mg = 3/4 mg.
Determine current direction: from N to M.
